TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ModelConfigurationBuilder extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a simple API surface for setting defaults and configuring conventions before they run.

remarks.para: You can use to configure the conventions for a context by overriding on your derived context. Alternatively you can create the model externally and set it on a instance that is passed to the context constructor.
See Pre-convention model building in EF Core for more information and examples.

You should only use it directly in your code with extreme caution and knowing that doing so can result in application failures when updating to a new Entity Framework Core release.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.TypeMappingConfigurationBuilder DefaultTypeMapping (Type scalarType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.TypeMappingConfigurationBuilder DefaultTypeMapping(class System.Type scalarType) cil managed
Public Overridable Function DefaultTypeMapping (scalarType As Type) As TypeMappingConfigurationBuilder

abstract member DefaultTypeMapping : Type -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.TypeMappingConfigurationBuilder override this.DefaultTypeMapping : Type -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.Builders.TypeMappingConfigurationBuilder

Docs.param: The scalar type to be configured.
Docs.summary: Marks the given type as a scalar, even when used outside of entity types. This allows values of this type to be used in queries that are not referencing property of this type.
Docs.returns: An object that can be used to configure the scalars.

remarks.para: Unlike this method should only be called on a non-nullable concrete type. Calling it on a base type will not apply the configuration to the derived types.
Calling this is rarely needed. If there are properties of the given type calling should be enough in most cases.
See Pre-convention model building in EF Core for more information and examples.

Docs.param: The scalar type to be configured.
An action that performs configuration for the scalars.
Docs.summary: Marks the given type as a scalar, even when used outside of entity types. This allows values of this type to be used in queries that are not referencing property of this type.
Docs.returns: The same instance so that additional configuration calls can be chained.

remarks.para: Unlike this method should only be called on a non-nullable concrete type. Calling it on a base type will not apply the configuration to the derived types.
Calling this is rarely needed. If there are properties of the given type calling should be enough in most cases.
See Pre-convention model building in EF Core for more information and examples.

Docs.typeparam: The scalar type to be configured.
Docs.summary: Marks the given type as a scalar, even when used outside of entity types. This allows values of this type to be used in queries that are not referencing property of this type. Calling this won't affect whether properties of this type are discovered.
Docs.returns: An object that can be used to configure the scalars.

remarks.para: Unlike this method should only be called on a non-nullable concrete type. Calling it on a base type will not apply the configuration to the derived types.
Calling this is rarely needed. If there are properties of the given type calling should be enough in most cases.
See Pre-convention model building in EF Core for more information and examples.
